definitions.definition: A slackening or arrest of the blood current , due not to a lessening of the heart’s beat, but to some abnormal resistance of the capillary walls.
Inactivity ; a freezing , or state of motionlessness .
examples: His company was sized for growth, not stasis .

definitions.definition: A technology allowing something to be artificially frozen in time , so that it does not age or change .
examples: I was in stasis for forty years before I woke up orbiting this poxy planet!

definitions.definition: One of the sections of a cathisma or portion of the psalter .

main_definition: ( pathology ) A slackening or arrest of the blood current , due not to a lessening of the heart’s beat, but to some abnormal resistance of the capillary walls.
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) Inactivity ; a freezing , or state of motionlessness .
( science fiction , uncountable ) A technology allowing something to be artificially frozen in time , so that it does not age or change .
One of the sections of a cathisma or portion of the psalter .
